Class FFMpegBuilder

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.FFMpegBuilder
public final class FFMpegBuilder extends Object
Builder class for convenience class FFMpeg

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FFMpegBuilder(@Nullable String ffmpegPath)
    This constructor initializes the class with the path to ffmpeg's command line utility.

  • Constructor Details

    • FFMpegBuilder

      public FFMpegBuilder(@Nullable @Nullable String ffmpegPath) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This constructor initializes the class with the path to ffmpeg's command line utility.
      Parameters:
      ffmpegPath - The relative path to ffmpeg's command line utility. This parameter must not be null only if the user is operating on a Windows Operating System.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If this constructor's argument is set to null and the user is running a Windows Operating System

  • Method Details

    • build

      @Contract(value=" -> new", pure=true) @NotNull public @NotNull FFMpeg build()
      Creates a new FFMpeg instance using the information given to this FFMpegBuilder instance.
      Returns:
      The created FFMpeg instance

    • getCommand

      public String getCommand()
      Convenience method to get the ffmpeg command to be executed.
      Returns:
      The command to be executed

    • add

      public void add(@NotNull @NotNull String elem) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Adds a new flag to the command to be executed.
      Parameters:
      elem - The flag to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given argument is null or an empty string

    • add

      public void add(int index, @NotNull @NotNull String elem) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method adds the given string at the given position inside the FFmpeg command.
      Parameters:
      index - The given position
      elem - The string to be inserted
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the second argument is null or an empty string

    • resetCommand

      public void resetCommand(@Nullable @Nullable String pathToFFMpeg) throws InvalidArgumentException, UnsupportedOperatingSystemException
      This method allows the user to reset the command of this Builder.
      Parameters:
      pathToFFMpeg - The path to the ffmpeg executable. This parameter must not be null only if the user is operating on a Windows Operating System.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the user is operating on a Windows Operating System and the parameter of this method is null.
      UnsupportedOperatingSystemException - If the user is operating on an operating system that is not supported by this library (i.e., all operating systems other than Windows and Linux OSs).

    • addInput

      public void addInput(@NotNull @NotNull String inputFile) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Adds the path to an input file to the command to be executed.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - The input file whose path is to be added to the command
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the argument given to this method is null or an empty string

    • newTracksMerger

      @Contract("_, _, _ -> new") @NotNull public @NotNull TracksMerger newTracksMerger(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile, @NotNull @NotNull String audioInput, @NotNull @NotNull String videoInput)
      Create a new TracksMerger instance given a video output file and an audio and a video input file.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The given video output file
      audioInput - The given audio input file
      videoInput - The given video input file
      Returns:
      The newly created TracksMerger instance

    • newTracksMerger

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull public @NotNull TracksMerger newTracksMerger(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile)
      This method performs the same action as newTracksMerger(String, String, String), but it should be used only when creating the final output video.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The path to the output file
      Returns:
      The newly created TracksMerger instance

    • newVideoCreator

      public VideoCreator newVideoCreator(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Returns a new VideoCreator instance given the path to the output file, the path to the input folder and the output file's extension. None of the values given to this method can be null.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The path to the output file This path has to be ffmpeg-compatible, and it must include the file extensions.
      Returns:
      A new VideoCreator instance
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If at least one of the given arguments is null or an empty string

    • newVideoTranscoder

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull public @NotNull VideoTranscoder newVideoTranscoder(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile)
      Returns a new VideoTranscoder instance given the path to the output file, the path to the input folder and the output file's extension.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The path to the output file
      Returns:
      A new VideoTranscoder instance

    • newAudioFiltering

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull public @NotNull AudioFiltering newAudioFiltering(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method returns a new AudioFiltering instance.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The given output audio file.
      Returns:
      A new AudioFiltering instance made using the given output audio file.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given audio file is null or an empty string

    • addAllInputs

      public void addAllInputs(@NotNull @NotNull String @NotNull ... inputFiles) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Same as for addInput(), but this can add multiple files. Throws NotEnoughArgumentsException if the input value is null or if one of the input values is null.
      Parameters:
      inputFiles - The list of paths of the input files to be added to the command
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - When one of the arguments given to this method is null

    • addAllInputs

      public void addAllInputs(@NotNull @NotNull List<String> inputFiles) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Same as for addInput(), but this can add multiple files. Throws NotEnoughArgumentsException if the input value is null or if one of the input values is null.
      Parameters:
      inputFiles - The list of paths of the input files to be added to the command
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - When the argument given to this method is null or contains a null value or an empty string

    • addOutput

      public void addOutput(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Adds the path of an output file to the command.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The path of the output file to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given argument is null or an empty string
